summary: About 45% of people released from federal prison are re-arrested or return within 3 years. The First Step Act of 2018 requires the Bureau of Prisons to assess incarcerated people's: Risk of recidivism (reoffending) Needs that, if met, could potentially reduce that risk Based on these assessments, the Bureau can place people into programs where they may earn credits toward early release. title: Federal Prisons: Improvements Needed to the System Used to Assess and Mitigate Incarcerated People’s Recidivism Risk
